page.title: 04ECOLOGY IN BOOTHBY PAGNELL
page.content: In Boothby there was evidence of conservation,pollution and changes. The conservation was in the form of trees planted in hedgerows,possibly replacing elms which had died of Dutch Elm disease.A bit of an eyesore was a pile of old tyres which were the only sign of pollution.Several cottages had disappeared without trace.Many paths were overgrown and some were non_existent.Some merged into water_filled ditches and became bogs.A field was being drained.A JCB digger was stationary in the field,probably being used to lay pipes.
